intro: Luehea tessmannii, commonly known as the yellow spondias, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, simple leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, yellow-orange fruits with a sweet, acidic flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
